etymology.description: 过(excessive) + 敏(sensitive) = abnormally sensitive; allergic.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of excess with sensitivity to express an abnormally strong bodily response to a substance. Now chiefly a medical term for allergy and, by extension, hypersensitivity.
etymology.simplification: 過→过 reduces strokes by simplifying the complex phonetic component, streamlining a high-frequency 辶-character; 敏 unchanged.

parts.english: to pass; to exceed; too/excessive; to cross

examples.chinese: 我对花粉过敏(我對花粉過敏)。
他吃了花生后出现过敏反应(他吃了花生後出現過敏反應)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chī le huāshēng hòu chūxiàn guòmǐn fǎnyìng.
examples.english: He developed an allergic reaction after eating peanuts.

examples.chinese: 如果症状严重，要立刻服用抗过敏药(如果症狀嚴重，要立刻服用抗過敏藥)。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ zhèngzhuàng yánzhòng, yào lìkè fúyòng kàngguòmǐn yào.
examples.english: If the symptoms are severe, take anti-allergy medicine immediately.
